WorkItem.Description: The documentation for ConfigurationStore implies it will search all config files. The code seems to imply it too since it uses a foreach over the directory. The problem is it only returns the modules found for the first config file containing a modules section. My expectation from reading the documentation (and what I want it to do) is to return all the modules referenced in all config files for the directory.

Comments.Message: Patch 1700 changes previous behavior to return contents of all config files' module sections, not just the first one found.
I'm not a big fan of enumerating of ALL the config files. What id there is some garbage. I'm in favor of having a way to specify a specific config file path (or a collection of the config files).

Hi,
As of Prism v4 documentation, there is no mention to the behavior youâ€™re explaining. Currently, the ConfigurationStore internally uses the ConfigurationManager class (http://msdn.microsoft.com/es-es/library/system.configuration.configurationmanager.aspx) to retrieve the specific Modules Section to configure the ModuleCatalog.
If you wish to implement a different behavior for that, you could create a different implementation of IConfigurationStore and create a different implementation of IModuleCatalog (similar to the ConfigurationModuleCatalog, but using your new implementation of IConfigurationStore).
Thank you for your feedback.

Miguel Bronzovic
